contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox University |name = Oslo University College |native_name = Høgskolen i Oslo |latin_name = |image = [[Image:Hio logo english.jpg]] |motto = OUC provides knowledge for a lifetime (translated from Norwegian) |established = 1994 |type = State College |endowment = |staff = 1100 |faculty = |president = |provost = |principal = |rector = Sissel Østberg |chancellor = |vice_chancellor = |dean = |head_label = |head = |students = 12,000 |undergrad = |postgrad = |doctoral = |city = Oslo |state = |country = Norway |campus = |free_label = |free = |colors = |colours = |mascot = |nickname = |affiliations = |website = http://www.hio.no }} '''Oslo University College (OUC)''', ''Norwegian: Høgskolen i Oslo (HiO)'' is the largest state university college in [[Norway]], with more than 18,000 students and approx. 1800 employees.<ref name="staff">[http://www.hio.no/welcome_to_ouc/about_ouc Facts about OUC] [http://www.hio.no/welcome_to_ouc/about_ouc/facts_and_figures]</ref> OUC offers the broadest portfolio of professional studies available in Norway. OUC was established August 1, 1994 when the Norwegian college system was restructured and 18 smaller colleges in the Oslo area merged. Most of the school is now (from 2007) located in the city centre of Oslo along Pilestredet street. The main campus is the previous Frydenlund Brewery near Bislett stadium. Oslo University College and [[Akershus University College]] merged into [[Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences]] on August 1, 2011. The language of instruction is [[Norwegian language|Norwegian]], but certain courses are taught in English. == Faculties == *Faculty of Art, Design and Drama *Faculty of Social Sciences *Faculty of Education and International Studies *Faculty of Engineering *Faculty of Health Sciences *Faculty of Journalism, Library and Information Science *Faculty of Nursing == Centres == *Centre for Educational Research and Development *Centre for the Study of Professions *National Centre for Multicultural Education *Learning Centre ==External links== *[http://www.hio.no Oslo University College website] *[http://www.hio.no/content/view/full/4862 Courses taught in English at Oslo University College] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Norwegian_Educational_Institutions}} {{coord|59|55|18.73|N|10|44|0.26|E|type:edu|display=title}} [[Category:Oslo University College|*]] [[Category:Education in Oslo]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in Norway|Oslo]] [[Category:Florence Network]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1994]] {{Norway-university-stub}}
